intro: Melochia bracteosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or bracteosa melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Melochia bracteosa is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
